intro: Xiphopterella nudicarpa, commonly known as the naked-fruited fern, is a rare and distinctive member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, strap-like fronds that are typically light green and lack spore-bearing structures on the leaves. The plant produces small, clustered sporangia on the underside of its fronds, which are often covered in fine hairs. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
